1.title: First Episode Ever
1.plot: Tesla Powerwall, Microsoft Build, Patrick Norton's Raspberry Pi streamer, and catch up with Kate Botello.

2.title: Kevin Rose
2.plot: Kevin Rose covers Uber valuation worth $50 Billion, get a gold Apple Watch for $10, and catching up with Morgan Webb.

3.title: BattleBots Return
3.plot: The BattleBots are back, build your own GameBoy with Limor Fried from adafruit.com, a blast from the past with Martin Sargent, and Leo and Padre answer viewer questions.

4.title: Nine Dollar Computer
4.plot: A $9 computer, build your own automatic cat feeder, a visit from the Giz Wiz, a robot that wants to stab you, and Martin Sargent and Leo answer your tech questions.

5.title: Trey Ratcliff
5.plot: Mike Elgan takes us through the highlights of Google I/O, Photographer Trey Ratcliff talks about The Arcanum and photography with Voice Over Actor Jim Cutler, plus inside the Kickstarter project called Cubit.

6.title: Raspberry Pi
6.plot: Leo sets things on fire and lives to tell about it, how to partition your drive for Windows 10, using VR in the classroom, the Raspberry Pi Evangelist is here to show you how to get started, and Roger and Leo answer your tech questions.

7.title: Photoshop Secrets with Bert Monroy
7.plot: The best - and worst - of Apple's WWDC, supercharge your Wi-Fi signal, and become a Photoshop expert in 5 minutes.

8.title: E3 with Jeff Gerstmann
8.plot: We talk E3 with Jeff Gerstmann, Catherine Hall shows us how to take a portrait, Trey Ratcliff shows us the latest Sony cameras, and a peek inside your cat's guts.

9.title: For the Love of Spock
9.plot: Leo and Adam Nimoy reminisce about his father and the making of the film "For the Love of Spock", Robert gives us the low down on the new High Dynamic Range TV sets, a Drone Kit teaching robotics to kids, and more.

10.title: Enabling the Future - Printing 3D Arms for Kids
10.plot: Enabling the Future prints 3D arms for disabled kids, saving earth from asteroids with astronomer Gerald McKeegan, play music on your clothes with DrumPants, and Fr. Robert Ballecer and Patrick Norton answer your tech questions.

11.title: Pluto Scientist
11.plot: We're joined by a scientist from the New Horizons Pluto team, Frederick Van Johnson shows you how to make your photos shine on Lightroom, Makey Makey Go with the the founder and CEO of Vufine, plus Leo and Megan answer your tech questions.

12.title: Windows 10
12.plot: Paul Thurrott's Top 10 for Windows 10, a research seismologist joins in to talk about earthquake prediction and that article in the New Yorker about the earthquake that's going to destroy the West Coast, and more.

13.title: Blackhat and Defcon Preview
13.plot: Padre's Black Hat preview, how to sell your app, Motorola phone announcements, Bill Nye film, replacement for Windows Movie maker, First Person View Drone Racing, and more.

14.title: Andy Weir 'The Martian' Movie
14.plot: Behind the scenes of 'The Martian' movie with Andy Weir, Jason Howell is building an arcade cabinet, musician Clay Bell performs live, Steve Gibson talks Defcon and Black Hat, and more.

15.title: Neil Armstrong's Spacesuit
15.plot: The Smithsonian wants to save Neil Armstrong's spacesuit and needs your help with their Kickstarter project, Becky Worley has some odd gadgets to show off including a food sniffer, and who owns the rights to "The Happy Birthday Song".

16.title: Note 5 vs OnePlus Two
16.plot: The Note 5 versus the OnePlus Two, NASA has Martians in Hawaii, Ashley Madison in disarray, and a way to make your GoPro footage look rock-solid.

17.title: Social Media and Politics
17.plot: How political campaigns are using social media to influence your vote, El Niño is on the way, and a man who invented a Twitter bot that has won thousands of contests has now invented a revolutionary car battery.

18.title: 3D Printed Hearts
18.plot: Intel launches the new SkyLake processors, 3D printed hearts saving the lives of children, what happens to the lost data when you compress music to MP3, and live from the big IFA show in Berlin.

19.title: iPad Pro & Kitty Cam
19.plot: The latest announcements from Apple, feline facial detection, how to surf the Dark Web, and it's a bird. It's a plane. It's the world's first International Drone Conference.

20.title: Making Ready for World Maker Faire
20.plot: A victory for dancing babies everywhere after a major appeals court ruling affecting copyright infringement, making you ready for World Maker Faire!, and the Founder of SPACEVR about virtual reality in space.

21.title: iPhone 6s
21.plot: The best of Maker Faire World, TechCrunch CoHero, the BB-8 robot tear-down, Leo answers your questions and Pomplamoose plays live.

22.title: Water on Mars
22.plot: Hear from the man who found water on Mars, the 8th grade teacher who mixes science with rap, plus use your smartphone to test your heart rate, track your sleep, and check out the gunk in your ears.

23.title: The Man Behind TOR
23.plot: Microsoft's new gear, the creator of the Onion and TOR Projects, astronauts training for Space at the bottom of the sea, the best cord-cutting app you've never heard of, and it's International Light Saber Day.

24.title: Back to the Future
24.plot: New Steve Jobs movie, speaker in a jar, and it's time to go back to the present.

25.title: Magic Wheelchairs
25.plot: Meet the folks transforming children's wheelchairs into incredible costumes, how bots will take the place of apps, Ben Heck's Halloween hacks, plus we'll answer your tech questions live.

26.title: Halloween
26.plot: Gamergate, monster maker, paranormal investigator, and Friday the 13th game.

27.title: Sup Pop and Steam Carnival
27.plot: Sub Pop founder Bruce Pavitt, audio guru Anthony Grimani, and the STEAM Carnival comes to town.

28.title: From Floppy Disks to Machine Learning
28.plot: The tech behind machine learning, the man who still sells floppies, and the new iPad Pro.

29.title: Photography from 10-thousand Feet
29.plot: Photos from 10-thousand feet, AirBNB for your pets, and the 17-year-old who's going to save the world from Ebola.

30.title: Cooking for Geeks
30.plot: Learn how to cook like a scientist with Cooking for Geeks author Jeff Potter, and keep your computer safe with F-Secure Chief Research Officer Mikko Hyponnen.

31.title: Top Video Games for the Holidays
31.plot: Lauren Hockenson from The Next Web reviews the hot video games for the holiday season, teaching schoolchildren to code with the The Hour of Code, the hot new $5 Raspberry Pi Zero computer, and a 3D scanner.

32.title: Very Maker Christmas
32.plot: We meet the man who will use stem cells to grow you a new set of teeth. The folks from Fictiv are here with a tear down of a perfectly good Dyson Ball vacuum cleaner.

33.title: Star Wars and Santa Tracking
33.plot: Star Wars: The Force Awakens, NORAD Santa Tracking, and The Original Trilogy Despecialized Edition.

34.title: Best of 2015
34.plot: TWiT Staff's favorite tech of 2015 and what they hope to see in 2016. Call for Help with Captain Jack Ferret and his YouTube videos, and Margot needed some advice on a Linux-specific laptop.

35.title: CES 2016
35.plot: The best of CES with Robert Ballecer and Dick DeBartolo and Sam Abuelsamid talks the latest in car tech, Noah Diffenbaugh Stanford Earth Syste Science Professor talks with us about the tech that tracks El Nino, and more.

36.title: Editing DNA and Electric Motorbikes
36.plot: We'll talk with a Stanford scientist who is using CRISPR to edit and modify DNA with the hope of curing diseases. CNET's Tim Stevens is at the North American International Auto Show with the latest technology in cars.

37.title: Augmented Reality Sandbox
37.plot: Leo and Frederick talk film cameras, Google Photo date errors, and the Augmented Reality Sandbox.

38.title: Game of Geeks
38.plot: We talk with Konstantin Batygin about finding the ninth planet from the Sun. Padre takes a test drive in Aricmoto an electric vehicle for the rest of us. Jason Howell reviews AmpliTube. Frederick VanJohnson reviews the Panasonic GX8 camera.

39.title: Cap'n Crunch
39.plot: John "Cap'n Crunch" Draper, Anonabox Project Blue, Looplabs' online digital audio workstation, how politicians and political analysts use big data, protecting your kids online.

40.title: Gravitational Waves Discovered
40.plot: Gravitational waves with a physicist on the LIGO project, we begin our build of the Ultimate VR Gaming Machine, Leo and Ron get their ears 3D scanned, and Moldover the godfather of controllerism shows off his effects for voice and guitar.

41.title: Apple vs. FBI
41.plot: Leo Laporte and Megan Morrone talk Apple vs the Feds with Julian Sanchez, Senior Fellow Cato Institute. Ryan Shrout, host of TWiCH helps us build a mother of motherboards for THE ULTIMATE VIRTUAL REALITY GAMING MACHINE, and more.

42.title: I Like Big Maps and I Cannot Lie
42.plot: Meet the man turning complex data sets into interesting maps, it's week three as we build the Ultimate VR Gaming Machine and Ryan Shrout joins us to talk about the GPU, and a wrap-up of Mobile World Congress.

43.title: Raspberry Pi 3
43.plot: Leo and Padre check out the $35 Raspberry Pi 3, the $79 Endless Mini, and the Samsung Galaxy S7. Plus, Jason Howell interviews Jason Calacanis at the Launch Festival and we continue building the Ultimate VR Gaming Machine.

44.title: Obama Talks Encryption at #SXSW
44.plot: We chat with the president of the American Go Association live from Seoul South Korea. We pick the RAM for our Ultimate VR Gaming Machine. We connect with Brian Reich on Obama's talk on encryption straight from #SXSW.

45.title: That Dragon, Cancer
45.plot: Leo Laporte and Florence Ion take a first look at the new LG G5, Padre and OMGChad wrap-up the Game Developers Conference, a live report from the Silicon Valley Comic Con, meet the makers of the video game That Dragon Cancer, and more.

46.title: Microsoft's Nazi Sex ChatBot
46.plot: Microsoft's Tay AI goes from sweet teen to filthy racist in less than a day, Scott Jung has the latest in Medical Tech, and Allyn Malventano tells us everything we need to know about SSDs.

47.title: Oculus Rift and VR Extravaganza
47.plot: Ryan Strout joins us as Leo flips the switch to the Ultimate Virtual Reality Gaming Machine. The Oculus Rift gets unboxed and broken in while Peter Rubin of Wired gives us his review.

48.title: Maker, Maker, Maker
48.plot: Leo Laporte and Aaron Newcomb look at the RaspPi 3 versus the Odroid c2 and show off some of Aaron's latest projects. We'll take a look at the latest MakerBot Replicator 5 3D printer.

49.title: From Russia with Code
49.plot: Leo Laporte and Father Robert Ballecer talk about the Facebook F8 event and live streaming now for everyone. We'll talk with our call for help guest about setting up a Pan, Tilt, Zoom camera.

50.title: DIY Minecraft Server
50.plot: Leo shows a kindergarten teacher how to build a Minecraft server, a School Grown Aquaponics project, the best new tech from the NAB conference, and Scott Jung with the latest Med Tech.

51.title: Leo Explains Linux
51.plot: Looking for other planets in space with Dr. Steve Howell, Project Scientist from NASA. We'll try out some of the newest in doggy tech with Keith Miller from Bubbly Paws Dog Wash in Minnesota. Which Linux distro is best for a older computer?

52.title: Kate Botello Returns!
52.plot: Leo and Kate Botello talk with Ian Burkhart, a quadriplegic, who can move his hand thanks to a machine learning computer and a chip in his brain. Kate tries VR and we'll hear from former Screen Savers Patrick Norton and Kevin Rose.

53.title: Raspberry Pi Arcade Cabinet
53.plot: Leo and Jason Howell talk to woodworker Dyami Plotke about the Raspberry Pi-powered arcade cabinet he built for Jason, Geophysicist Julian Lozos and the earthquake that will drop Los Angeles into the ocean, and Leo puts Linux on Jason's Chromebook Pixel.

54.title: Google I/O and All About SSDs
54.plot: Leo Laporte and Iain Thomson talk all about Google I/O 2016 and Oracle v. Google with Parker Higgins from the Electronic Frontier Foundation. Allyn Malventano educates us about SSDs. We answer your questions about connecting a printer to a Raspberry Pi. Our med tech Scott Jung shows us the Nima, Spire, and VitalPatch. Padre attendes Maker Faire Bay Area in San Mateo. That and much more.

55.title: Saving Humanity from Asteroids
55.plot: We talk to a Planetary Scientist from Lawrence Livermore Labs who develops strategies to prevent our extinction from meteorite impacts. What the Oracle v. Google verdict means. How to prevent the automatic update to Windows 10.

56.title: Junk in the Tronc
56.plot: Replacing hard drives with SSDs, we continue our ultimate SSD guide with Allyn Malventano, Leo reviews the System76 Linux laptop, how to power your Raspberry Pi or Arduino with voltage regulators, and more.

57.title: Twitter's 'Fail Whale' Creator
57.plot: Leo Laporte and Jason Calacanis talks about Gawker filing for bankruptcy over the Hogan lawsuit, the artist behind Twitter's "Fail Whale" Yiying Lu talks about creative inspiration and her delicious upcoming Emoji, and more.

58.title: WWDC, E3, and OnePlus 3
58.plot: Leo Laporte is joined by co-host Florence Ion to talk to Ernesto Omar Falcon from the EFF about Net Neutrality ruling, Fr. Robert Ballecer and Bryan Burnett update us on the latest at E3 2016, and more.

59.title: Stuxnet and 'Zero Days' the Movie
59.plot: Leo Laporte is joined by co-host Ron Richards to talk with guests Eric Chien and Liam O'Murchu about the Stuxnet virus and the Alex Gibney movie "Zero Days," Tony Wang reviews of the mamaRoo infant seat, and more.

60.title: To Jupiter with Juno
60.plot: The Juno spacecraft prepares to enter Jupiter's orbit and we'll hear from a scientist on the NASA project, TASBot plays Nintendo with superhuman abilities, and more.

61.title: Gotta Catch Pokémon GO
61.plot: Pokemon Go is taking the country by storm. The Segway folks are here with two new smaller scooters, the miniPRO and the Ninebot One. Aaron Newcomb tells us what it takes to start a Makerspace.

62.title: $50 Linux Computer in Your Pocket
62.plot: Leo Laporte and Fr. Robert Ballecer talk about Pokemon GO servers and scaling issues. Dave Rauchwerk, CEO of C.H.I.P., shows us his new product, the PocketCHIP, a $50 Linux computer that you can fit in your pocket.

63.title: Mapping Pokémon GO
63.plot: Leo Laporte and Megan Morrone talk with an expert about the insides of Pokémon GO. We'll meet one of the folks who built a live map of Pokémon locations.

64.title: Digital Fugitive Hunter
64.plot: Leo Laporte and Jason Howell are joined by Craig Allen to play Father.io, a massive multi-player laser tag for mobile phones. Digital fugitive hunter and a cast member of 'Hunted' joins us to talk about the 'Jason Bourne' movie.

65.title: The World's Smallest Computer
65.plot: A computer the size of a grain of rice. We'll talk with David Blaauw, from the University of Michigan whose team has developed the world's smallest computer.

66.title: High-Tech Booze
66.plot: Leo Laporte and Alex Lindsay talk about Twitter's 10-Year failure to stop harassment. CEO and Founder of Cleveland Whiskey Tom Lix joins us to talk about a faster way to age whiskey.

67.title: Movin' to the Eastside
67.plot: Leo Laporte gives you a tour of the Eastside Studio and offices. We'll visit the home kitchen of Chef J .Keni López-Alt, the Managing Culinary Director of Serious Eats, and see how he cooks using technology.

68.title: Open-Source Underwater Drone
68.plot: Leo Laporte and Iain Thomson talk with the Co-Founder of OpenROV Eric Stackpole about their newest open-source underwater drone, the Trident. See another edition of our popular Game of Geeks segment.

69.title: Living a Year on 'Mars'
69.plot: Leo Laporte and Aaron Newcomb talk about the Samsung Note 7 recall and the upcoming Apple event, we interview a crew member of the HI-SEAS project who spent a year in isolation simulating a Mars mission on a mountain in Hawaii, and more.

70.title: The New iPhone 7 and PS4 Pro
70.plot: Leo Laporte and Ron Richards is joined by David Pogue to talk about Apple's September event, including the iPhone 7. Sony announced their new PS4 lineup, and Nintendo is finally bringing Mario to mobile.

71.title: Episode #1.71
71.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

82.title: Microsoft Surface Studio
82.plot: Leo Laporte and Rene Ritchie review the Microsoft Surface Studio while an award-winning author and illustrator put it through the paces. Turn your bike into a light show with Monkey Lights. Fr. Robert Ballecer, SJ has some gadgets that will make traveling with kids this holiday season a lot easier. Megan Morrone reviews mobile payments apps that make money transfers easier. What is the best way to run Windows on a Mac between Boot Camp, CrossOver Mac, VirtualBox, Parallels Desktop, or VMware Fusion?

91.title: Android Wear 2.0 and New LG Watch Style & Sport
91.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

92.title: June Smart Oven - Cooking in the Future
92.plot: Leo Laporte and Alex Wilhelm get cooking with the June Intelligent Oven. It connects to your smartphone and promises to make cooking easier. Leo reviews the new Samsung Chromebook Plus convertible touch laptop. Roger Anderson of the Jolly Roger Telephone Co. is back with his AI. This one targets Windows support scammers. How much of your information is public on Facebook? Megan Morrone shows us stalkscan.com which highlights just that. Bodo Hoenen and Lorelei are back to give us a quick update on their DIY assistive arm. Jason Howell has a few apps to help you tune, ...

imdb.plot outline: The New Screen Savers is a variety show for tech on the TWiT network. The show stars Leo Laporte and is co-hosted by Megan Morrone, Jason Howell, Fr. Robert Ballecer, and Bryan Burnett. Viewers get live tech help, interesting guests, insights into the latest innovations, products and trends, plus lots of fun things thrown in, too. There will also be special guest co-host appearances from Patrick Norton, Kate Botello, Kevin Rose, Martin Sargent, and more.
imdb.title: The New Screen Savers
plot: _The New Screen Savers_ (qv) is a variety show for tech on the TWiT network. The show stars Leo Laporte and is co-hosted by Megan Morrone, Jason Howell, Fr. Robert Ballecer, and Bryan Burnett. Viewers get live tech help, interesting guests, insights into the latest innovations, products and trends, plus lots of fun things thrown in, too. There will also be special guest co-host appearances from Patrick Norton, Kate Botello, Kevin Rose, Martin Sargent, and more.
